snippet: The two-month-long budget crisis in California took a large step toward conclusion early this morning when the State Senate reluctantly passed an austere recession-era budget that cuts deeply into health and welfare services and state support for ...
lead_paragraph: The two-month-long budget crisis in California took a large step toward conclusion early this morning when the State Senate reluctantly passed an austere recession-era budget that cuts deeply into health and welfare services and state support for cities and counties. The bill, which closely resembles the no-new-taxes plan proposed by the Republican Governor, Pete Wilson, now goes to the fractious State Assembly, where its fate is uncertain. But with the Democratic-controlled Senate having passed it by a solid 33-to-5 vote, the Assembly has been put in the difficult position of either yielding to the Governor or plunging the state still deeper into crisis.

headline.main: California Senate Reluctantly Passes Grim Budget
